It was 2019 and I was clueless.

My laptop was yet to say hello to the world, and everybody else seemed to have a head start.

But then as I took the first steps to enter this space, I had Yajas debugging the simplest of my codes, finding mistakes he didn’t know were possible to make. And then Mishra, making sense of the loops, both in my head and on my screen long before I knew his first name was Ayush.

Over time, as I transitioned from being an absolute noob to someone with a little intuition, the role these people played in my life also progressed.

There was Naman bouncing off the weirdest approaches to a problem.

And then came Pranav who listened to my 5979164 ideas, all at once, only to be innocently surprised at how they did/didn’t work. The patience it must have taken!

And ofc Divyanshu, being the constant pillar of support:”)

Courtesy you wonderful people, I enjoyed the process even when I was clueless. Laughing at my mistakes while you gave me quizzical expressions I knew that I was growing, and so were you.

As much as I’d like to believe it has all been just me, I know it was always backed by someone who looked at me and said “Tu kar legi” with shiny eyes. You know who you all are, and thank you so much!

P.S. I’ll be interning at Microsoft Hyderabad starting next month. The picture definitely captures my emotions of it being remote. Would love to get in touch and engage with people doing the same and make this a wholesome experience!

P.P.S. For ones preparing for interviews, please take the time to explain your approach regularly to people around. The clarity of thought, as well as the shift in communication style this brings, is unparalleled and quite evident.

#microsoft #techinterviews #sde

The man with No Haters! DK 

The story of Dinesh Karthik is amazing.

He was doing very well and was the 2nd wkt keeper to MS in the Indian team and was captain of TN. 

His teammate Murali Vijay was having an affair with his wife and the entire TN Ranji team knew this but not DK.

Finally one day she told him she was pregnant carrying Murali Vijay's child and wanted a divorce. 

They had a divorce and she moved in with Murali who was opening for CSK and India and doing well. 

DK was shattered, went into a deep depression, grew a beard, became a Devdas, his performance dipped, and he was dropped from the India squad. 

He started failing in Ranji and lost his captaincy to Murali Vijay. He started failing in IPL too and was so depressed felt let down by his Ranji teammates and wanted to commit suicide. He stopped going to the gym.

His trainer visited him in his house and found DK in a complete mess. He insisted Dk start his training again and got him back to the gym where he was training Deepika Pallikal also.

Shocked to see him in a sorry state she started counselling him along with the trainer and slowly he started training. Both started working out like maniacs.

Murali Vijay married his wife but started failing, was first dropped from the Indian team and later from CSK also.

Meanwhile encouraged by Deepika, DK started nets and scored heavily in the domestic matches. 

He was back in the reckoning, was again selected for white-ball cricket for India and became the captain of KKR. He married Deepika.

However, after a few years, Rishab came and took his place.
At 34 he knew his time was up and he was dropped from KKR as captain. He wanted to retire and just play IPL. 

His wife got pregnant and they had twins. She also stopped playing. 

His dream was to own a luxurious house which he got as an offer at Poes garden. It cost a lot and he was not too sure if he could afford it. 

Deepika said grab it, we will both come back. She started training along with DK. They bought the palatial house in Poes garden.

Deepika played the world championship at Glasgow in squash 6 months after delivery and won both the mixed doubles and women's double. 

An energised father, now DK started kicking ass.
Hope he makes it this time once again!! 

#cricket #ipl #india #motivation #inspiration #nevergiveup

I graduated last year in July 2021 with Rank 1.
Luckily I got a conversion offer from Intern to Full-Time at the leading open source software company and my dream MNC(since second year of my engineering) . 
Also received 30+ Red Hat Rewards. Explored a lot from giving talks (20+ talks, 6 worldwide) to learning new skills like Golang ✨

Through the journey I made sure I am mentally fit 💜️ I took enough and needed breaks from work and study. 
3 months ago I also started content creation in the form of videos on Youtube. Things are really going at some fast paced speed for me and I am embracing all the new changes with strength. 

✅ The most significant lesson here is to explore everything, try learning new stuff but don’t forget self-care.

✅ Also as an employer make sure all your employees take enough breaks, enjoy the work. Make sure to provide a good work-life balance to all in the organisation. Acknowledge the hard work that your team puts in. Make employees wellness a part of the org culture. We grow when we support and take care of each other 🤝

On the same note, the Class of 2022 will be graduating in a few months. 
Some of them would already be having pre-placement offers, others would be preparing hard for that dream job. A few would also be going for Masters in specific domains. 
At this point of the life journey, we often stay very stressed. 
But trust me you have lots of time and this is just the beginning. If you put consistent efforts then you will get anything and everything. 


Prioritize self care and take care of your mental health. 

LinkedIn for Creators 
LinkedIn

I have been asked from time to time about my preparation strategies, resources I took help from and many similar queries about my selection at The D. E. Shaw Group and Goldman Sachs. So, I thought to jot down the answers to all such queries.

🤔 How did you apply?

✅ Goldman — It was an off-campus opportunity and I applied directly on the GS portal without any referral
✅ Shaw — It was an on-campus opportunity

⏳ How much time did I take for the prep?

I started preparing for internships after the lockdown happened in 2020 March (it was halfway through my 4th sem). For the initial 3-4 months I prepared very rigorously. But once, I grasped a grip on DSA, I became less regular (not recommended at all ❌) and eventually used to resume only when there was an OA or interview...

🗣️ Interview Processes?

✅ Goldman (off-campus) — 1 Aptitude OA (pretty decent/hard level), 1 Technical round (2 small coding questions, 1 advanced coding q., a maths section, a CS fundamentals section), 2 technical interviews, 1 managerial round
✅ Shaw (on-campus) — 1 OA (2 coding q., an aptitude section and a CS fundamental section), 2 technical interviews, 1 managerial round (may or may not take place)

📝 Resources used for DSA?

After building a good grip on DSA through Leetcode, I did some amazingly curated lists for revisions and to cover all the important topics:

1. Strivers’ Sheet: https://bit.ly/3vydeKg
2. Leetcode’s Top Interview Questions’ List: https://bit.ly/3Ktr19i
3. Interview Experiences from GfG: https://bit.ly/3MKiuQK

❓ How many questions did I solve?

I solved a total of 600+ questions on Leetcode. Seems overwhelming right? But I achieved this in a long span. In the end, everything boils down to the quality of questions you’ve solved and not the quantity. So, the moment you feel confident about a certain topic, you’re good to go!

🖥️ Any YouTube channels I followed?

Techdose, takeUforward, Back To Back SWE, Nick White, Kevin Naughton Jr, Aditya Verma, and a few others.

🎯 Important DSA topics to focus upon?

Arrays (Binary Search, Hash Map, Two pointers, Greedy, Sliding Window), Trees, Graph, Linked List, Stack & Queue, Heap, Strings, Recursion (Backtracking), Dynamic Programming

🤝🏻 Can you refer me?

Sure, I would love to do so. But wait for me to post about the opportunity where I can refer you, and then you can reach out to me!

I meet this guy I know from work, and he talks about big dreams.

And people.

And a lot of money.

Conversations about who can bring me my next big break, my next huge project, and opportunities. 

We hardly talk of who we are as people, and he never asks me anything that is not about how we can grow even more. 

I lay in bed that night, wondering, is this what life has become now? 

Always in search of the next best opportunity, and coming to terms with the fact that in the process, we often end up viewing people as tools and means to an ulterior end?

I love networking and meeting new people- but I also want the human connect.

I know I shouldn't share an emotional take like this on LinkedIn, but my fingers clicked Post.

Q-commerce is a trend with high potential, already attracting many customers in many countries due to which Q-commerce startups are getting huge fundings from investors across the globe.

Statista and Crunchbase have published a list of leading q-commerce start-ups from all over the world and their recent funding. The data show that U.S.-based Gopuff is by far the most well-funded start-up in the quick-commerce field in this comparison of global players. With a total of US$3.4 billion in funding received before March 2022, goPuff can count on almost twice as much financial resources as second-placed Getir, a Turkish company which received total funding of US$1.8 billion.

MissFresh, a Chinese competitor, comes closely behind with US$1.7 billion in funding. 

Three more players received amounts greater than US$1 billion: The two German players Gorillas and Flink, and another player from China – DingDong.

Others in the list are Dunzo, JOKR, Zapp and Zepto.

Porsche 911 Sport Classic 2023

The 911 Sport Classic is back, and this time it is coming to the U.S. market. Featuring the distinctive and purpose-driven ducktail spoiler that pays tribute to the 911 Carrera RS 2.7 of the early 1970s, production of the new iteration is limited to 1,250 examples worldwide.

This new, limited-production model is a true driver's car. It features a unique powertrain to complement its special design, which pays homage to past Porsche models. This is also the second model borne of the Heritage Design strategy, which began with the 911 Targa 4S Heritage Design Edition in 2020.

Manual transmission, rear-wheel drive, and 543 hp

The new Porsche 911 Sport Classic is based on the 911 Turbo S, benefitting from its wide-body layout. Unlike the 911 Turbo models, the Sport Classic is available exclusively with a seven-speed manual transmission powering the rear wheels. Its engine, generating 543-hp and 442 lb.-ft. of torque, is the same 3.7-liter twin-turbo flat-six found in the 911 Turbo models with revised engine mapping to deliver output compatible with the manual transmission. That combination also makes this the most powerful 911 with a manual transmission currently available.

Because the new model is based on the 911 Turbo S, it too features a comprehensive list of high performance equipment. Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) with calipers in black, Porsche Dynamic Chassis Control (PDCC), Rear Axle Steering, the Sport Chrono Package, and a specially modified Sport Exhaust system are all included as standard. Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM) Sport is also standard and lowers the ride height by 10 millimeters. Due to the fact that this is a rear-wheel drive model, the front axle spring rates are slightly decreased by comparison to the all-wheel drive 911 Turbo S.

Despite its undeniable sports car pedigree, the Porsche 911 Sport Classic is designed with driver enjoyment in mind and while it's certainly up to the task of turning quick track laps, this limited-edition model emphasizes style and driving pleasure above all else.

Associate Professor Mazhar Ali, Heng Wu, Yaojia Wang and their research group from #TUDelft 
have discovered one-way superconductivity without magnetic fields, something that was thought to be impossible ever since its discovery in 1911. The discovery, published in Nature, makes use of 2D quantum materials and paves the way towards superconducting computing. Superconductors can make electronics hundreds of times faster, all with zero energy loss. Ali says: 'If the 20th century was the century of semi-conductors, the 21st can become the century of the superconductor.' Read more: https://lnkd.in/e3TMNbbC

I was travelling to Mumbai from Guwahati (Indigo flight 6E 6435), as Ramadan is going on, I was fasting. It was expected that I will break my fast on the flight and for the same, I was carrying a bottle of water (the corporate meal was booked anyways). When my fellow passenger (a Jain woman) got to know that I was fasting, she immediately took out her bag and offered me a couple of dates. Further, the IndiGo (InterGlobe Aviation Ltd)  team offered me dates and snacks to break my fast. I accepted dates from fellow aunty with gratitude and requested low sugar (as usual) coffee from the team Indigo. 

This is what diversity looks like in #MeraWalaIndia. Sometimes, small efforts can bring smiles to someone's face.  Let's take that small step and try bringing smiles to as many people as we could. 

P.S. I never thought a small gesture by a fellow passenger would spread so much positivity. Bonus point, she also asked me, Roze kaise jaa rahe hain tumhare (how is your fast going) and we discussed a couple of things about Ramdan & Paryushana.

Hey Connections, back with the weekly updates so this week was mostly about the first #project i.e Blog Site Mini Project for this we're separated between a group of 4 folks.

My group consists of sankalesh harak || Jitendra Trivedi || Kanishk Makkar 


TWO MODELS:-

--> Author Model (Schema)
--> Blog Model (Schema)

SEVEN API's:-

--> Post /authors -- To register as a author
--> Post /login  -- To login as a author
--> Post /blogs -- To create blogs
--> Get /blogs? --  To get list of published Blogs
--> Put /blogs/:blogId -- To update existing Blog data
--> Delete /blog/:blogId - To Delete Blog by it's Id
--> Delete /blogs? - To delete Blog By it's any properties

The API requests include createAuthors, loginAuthors, createBlog, getBlogs, updateBlog, deleteById, and deleteBlog by it's properties.

During development, the work was distributed among us by ourselves. We handled so many edge cases with  #authentication and #authorization using #jwt . all data was stored inside of a MongoDB database.

If you would like to see what we've done, click on the following link:- 
Darshit-dev/BlogginProject: Blogging project (github.com)

United we stand, United we Stay

On the 2nd of March 2021, beating the early-morning fatigue and packed Mumbai traffic, IKEA India and Decathlon Sports India were united by a common goal, that of blurring the lines between cultures, borders, and work ethos. It was my absolute pleasure to host this historic rendezvous as part of the “Handshake Program” on behalf of Decathlon Sports India. It gave us a common ground to share our core values and it was an eye-opener for all of us to realize how identically structured they are. Through each activity we collectively indulged in, such as playing various sports to having lunch together, we bridged the gap between our work cultures more and more and coalesced in our deeply rooted passion for the respective organizations we work in. It truly emphasized the positive outcomes of organizations co-existing harmoniously in the same ecosystem and how they can mutually benefit from others' principles. Needless to say, We couldn't have asked for a better cross-over!!

Why most of the product based startup fails sustain in India ? - Thoughts from my experience

I am one of the certified incubation managers by the University of Texas at Austin. At IIT Guwahati, I earned my PhD in Design (Product Design). Additionally, I am a certified Professional Engineer by the Institution of Engineers (India). What I am sharing are from my experience.

As you are all aware, business incubators and technological incubators are two types of incubation. Business incubators by nature and can primarily help with the business incubator function. Without a doubt, they are experts in this area.

Product-based startups must initially go through technology incubation. Following third-party audits, when the auditors certify that the product has reached Manufacturing Readiness Levels (MRL) 8 or 9, they should approach the Business Incubators. 

A third-party audit is essential for the successful launch of a product. Generally, I observe that product-based startups approach business incubators when their products reach MRL 3 or 4. As a result, most product-based startups are unable to sustain themselves in the competitive market.

No matter how hard the business incubator tries, if your product is not acceptable to the mass market, you will have a hard time becoming successful in the industry.

As an example, if someone is designing a new piece of furniture, various ergonomic factors must be considered during the design process. The use of 3D simulation software, such as Ansys, Catia, etc., is also essential.

If someone is working on a mobile application, then usability testing is a must. Similarly, they must prepare a solid, low-fidelity prototype before they begin programming.
The product will not be successful unless these steps are taken.

Our team came across a gentleman starting a business in the field of electric tourist vehicles. A price of 3 lakh rupees has been determined for the vehicle.

In response to our inquiry whether he had conducted the crash test of the vehicle (which is mandatory), he stated that he had not done so. 

The answer to our question concerning flow simulation and dashboard design was negative this time. Now, if he approaches any business incubator with an incomplete product, it is almost certain that the product cannot sustain itself in the market. It will not be fair for the entrepreneur to blame the Business Incubation Organization in such a situation.

A person interested in technological incubation and prototyping may visit the Tool Room and Training Center at Amin Gaon in addition to IITG.
One may approach the Assam Don Bosco University for bio-technical and biomechanical prototypes.
For prototypes relating to UAVs, one may approach Z-Motion, etc.

As a matter of fact, the generation of funds is secondary - unless the angel investor is not impressed with someone's product; it is difficult to find the right angel investor. They will invest when they are confident the new product will generate profits.

“I was born in a Dalit family, in a village in Akola. When I was 12, everyone pushed my dad to get me married to a man, 10 years my senior, who lived in Mumbai. My dad didn’t want to, but because of societal pressure, I was married off. 
I came here and learned that his family lived in one room in a slum and he didn’t even have a job. I was treated horribly – if there was extra salt in the food I cooked or any mistakes I made, I was beaten up by my in-laws... It was my personal hell. 
After 6 months, my father visited me – he couldn’t even recognize me. I was in ragged clothes and I’d lost my smile. He fought with my in-laws and took me home. Telling me to forget about it like a bad dream. 
But people started blaming me. I even tried to commit suicide - and they still said that I was giving up because I HAD done something wrong, not the other way around. It was then that I realised that if I was going to be blamed in any case, I’d rather live. 
With this new leaf turned, I returned to Mumbai and worked as a tailor. That was the first time I saw what Rs. 100 looked like. I rented a room in Kalyan with my savings and called my family here. We were managing fine - but when we couldn’t afford to save my sister’s life, I realised that I needed to make more money for my family. So I took a government loan and started my own furniture business. It was doing well and we began living a better life. 
But there were so many people out there struggling, just like I used to. So I started an NGO to help them get loans. Sometimes, I helped them out of my own pocket and slowly built a good reputation for my social work.
Which is why the workers of Kamani Tubes asked me to help save their company. It was tied up in 140 litigation cases, with a debt of 116 crores. Everyone told me that it was suicide – but 500+ families were starving! So I chose to help, wanting nothing but justice for them in return. I spoke to the finance minister and he got the debt reduced. I gathered a team and shifted factories. Everything I tried was new – but there was no fear left in me. 
In 2006, I became the chairman. We were told to pay off the bank loans within 7 years. We did it within 1 and we even managed to pay the workers. Slowly and surely, things changed and today, the turnover is more than we could dream of, I was even awarded the Padma Shri in 2013 for my work. I’ve had an unbelievable journey, from a Dalit Child-Bride to an owner of a multi-million dollar company. It’s been tough - but I’ve made sure to never let the fear of challenges overpower me. I took me a long time to learn that, but now that I have, I can’t choose to face life without having full faith in myself.”

#Nagaland has huge pool of young talents which are being undermined because of less exposure and lack of opportunities. 
This is not a new problem being addressed, the lifestyle of many educated youths without given a chance to prove themselves is proving to be fatal to the local economy as well. Now and in future!

They say youth are the future generation but what good are these youths if they just sit at home and play Chinese developed games while eating some noodles at the cost of their caregiver's expense?
How useful are these youths if they cannot earn their own daily bread, lead the community or teach their own young ones?

There is no one to blame here and all to worry; such scenario now can lead to lesser people who can lead the future era and the state could crack before global warming completely cracks the ozone holes.

In truer sense, we are looking at bleak coming of age generation with people who were either deprived of opportunities, was too lazy to work for a living or wasn't educated enough to make his way out into the market.

#Unemployment itself is a big market right now, if you tap correctly in the right area with the right thirst for talent - You will find a young and enthusiast treasure filled with gold of talents and diamond hard knowledge. 

Yes, Micro, Small & Medium Business exist with the rise of many entrepreneurs across the state but Reality Check - Everyone is not made to do business. All humans are not business oriented nor can they even finance it.
If we do the correct math, 90 people out of 100 total population cannot own a business. The logic of demand and supply also cease to exist.

Pass out the talent compass - Teach and guide us to the right path. Train people about the job and throw them to exercise those knowledge. Not everyone can run, own or lead a business per se.

Some people are made to lead, some to follow, some to work, some to learn while some are made to teach and that could be you!

Pass out the compass!

A quick tip for your next important video call - an interview, pitch, or any call you need to make a positive impression.

Get off your seat. Stand up. Put your laptop on a raised platform like some books or boxes, make sure you have plenty of light in front of you such as a window, and then rock and roll.

You'll convey more energy, you'll use your hands way more, you'll be more animated, be more engaging, you'll speak louder and more assertively, and you'll just connect so much better.

And you’re showing you’ve made a little more effort.

Listen, you should stand up even if the video is off and you're on a regular call - your voice projects better when standing, you speak with greater force and authority. With the video on it makes a heck of a lot of sense to get up for those meetings that matter.

Paper Alert! Delighted to announce that my PhD work is now published in Nature Communications. Here, we show that kidney epithelial cells are active mechano-biological fluid pumps. 

Brief Summary:
	The human kidney consists of roughly 30 kilometers of epithelial tubules that re-absorb 180L of water per day. I developed a microfluidic device to grow kidney epithelial cells in a physiologically relevant manner and measure fluid flow and pressure gradient developed across the epithelium. In doing so, we discovered that kidney epithelial cells behave like mechanical water pumps, in that they can pump fluid to generate a hydraulic pressure gradient. Epithelial cells regulate their fluid pumping performance by sensing this hydraulic pressure gradient. Additionally, I discovered that diseased kidney cells pump fluid in the reverse direction, creating cysts that render the system dysfunctional, adding novel mechanical insight to kidney epithelial function and disease.

#Mechanobiology #Tissuehydraulics #KidneyPump

What is difference between function statement and function expression?
Ans:)

Both does the almost same thing. The difference comes on how the browser loads and executes them

Function statement:- 
Function statement is loaded before any code is executed which is generally due to hoisting. 
This allows the function to be used before it is defined

Example :
function statement(){ }. // This is a function statement

Function expression:- 
Function expression associates a value to a variable (like any other expressions). 
It is loaded when the interpreter reaches that line of code

Example:
alert (foo ()) ; // Error
var foo=function () { }

If I could learn, just 5 finance rules in my life:- 

[1] Rule of 15*15*15:

- If you invest 15K monthly.
- At 15% growth.
- For 15 years.

It becomes 1Cr.

[2] 70% savings rule:

- If you are able to save 70%+ of your salary
- For 10 years
- And, do not undertake lifestyle inflation

Then, you can theoretically retire [that's the rule, I am not saying savings 70% is easy] 

[3] 4% withdrawal rule:

- For every INR 100 of savings, you could spend INR 4. And, your money would stay the same.
- Provided you can grow your wealth at 10%+. 
- Math: Assume inflation @6%, your money grows at 10%. So net you are making INR 4 on INR 100 savings.

[4] Improving your earning potential is the best investment: 

- Money making = adding value. 
- Hence, the more skilled you are (at any trait), the more value to can add. And, the more money you can make. 
- Best part, if you are skilled, you save your own time. 

[5] Time >> Money

- Theoretically, we can make infinite money. 
- But, all of us have finite amount of time (and we don't even know how much). 
- So keep meetings shorts, avoid unnecessary drama, cut toxic people; and don't waste your time and other people's time.

Manager - Hey Shivansh, you called me today morning?

Me - Yes! Since tomorrow is my last working day in the company, wanted to know when will I receive my PLI?

Manager - PLI?

Me - Performance linked incentive Sir! The money that our company dedicated from my salary with a promise that it'll be provided to be when I leave the company.

Manager - Sorry we cannot give the PLI to anyone who hasn't completed atleast 1 year in the company.

Me - But I wasn't told about this before. Also it isn't written anywhere in my offer letter!

Manager - Oh it isn't written? Sorry HR would must have forgotten to write it.

Me - With all due respect, your one sorry shouldn't cost me more than a lakh rupees!

Manager - Oh! But you should know that PLI is performance based. We can show that you were under performing and give you 0% PLI.

Me - How can I be under performing when I won 3 employee of the month awards in last 8 months!

Manager - Don't argue Shivansh! Let me see what can I do for you. But I cannot promise anything.

Me - Yes please try and do the needful as the amount is huge! If not full , kindly provide me a partial PLI.

I resigned with a hope of receiving my PLI along with other dues.

Finally after multiple calls to the HR, 
remaining settlement which included my notice period salary and leaves encashment was done after 2 months. I was surprised to see that a single penny wasn't given to me with context to the PLI.

I called the manager but he didn't respond.

After 90 days gap-
4 out of 5 developers of my previous organization joined my current organization.  My previous manager tried everything to stop them but wasn't able to!

I got a referral bonus for referring every one of them. The combined referral compensation was 2x of my PLI.

Moral of the story-
Don't mess with a coder! If he can decode 1000 lines of code, he can definitely do the same with your company's policy as well.

#engineer #coder #corporatelife 
#laughwithshivansh

A doctor need not know medicine to treat patients.

An architect need not know design, geometry and aesthetics.

An engineer need not know engineering.

A car mechanic need not know anything about car engine. 

And.... 

Finally a data scientist need not know math or statistics to train models. 

I am sorry, but these takes are ridiculous. 

"You don't have to know math to train model" is why 80% of the Data Science projects fail.

"All the optimization is carefully isolated from the user" - is the reason why people think Logistic Regression is not Regression (check the link in comments).

"All the optimization is carefully isolated from the user" - This abstraction is the reason why Data Science becomes unintuitive for Data Scientist and is even dangerous.

"All the optimization is carefully isolated from the user" - This is the reason why people keep using defaults like L2 regularization without even knowing it (Link in comments).

"What previously took talent and years of complex math studies now takes nothing." - Just because we have abstracted away the math, it does not mean the math under the hood has vanished.

The more one abstracts away, the more is the chance of doing data science wrongly. Data Science is just not about predictions. How these predictions are made and what ingredients led to those predictions also matter a lot.

#datascience #statistics #machinelearning #datascientist #artificialintelligence

Times are rapidly changing. The way the digital landscape has taken over all traditional forms of media is delightful to watch. Digital creators are making waves - both with their extensive reach & distribution and their refreshing content as well.

A key reason why film stars are very particular about collaborating with digital stars to talk about their next big project. Here are two key exhibits we see in front of us for the movie KGF 2:

1. Yash chose to work only with Niharika NM to create a hilarious video which made waves and how. It hit 1M views on Instagram within 3 hours and currently sits at 14M+ views across all platforms.

2. Sanjay Dutt chose to spend an hour on The Ranveer Show opening up about the darkest phases of his life and what we should learn from his mistakes.

What I love most about these collaborations is they happen on an equal footing, unlike other interactions. The creator appreciates the art that the film star is creating, the film star appreciates the grit it takes to build a massive social media audience.

If you can tell a great story about yourself, you’ll get jobs.

If you can tell a great story about your company, you’ll attract top talent.

If you can tell a great story about your product, people will buy it.

Storytelling is an underrated skill.

Bhagwant Mann, the Chief Minister of Punjab and my younger brother, along with his officers and ministers visited the wonderful government schools of Delhi.  Through collaboration, we will learn from each other, make Baba Saheb's dream come true, and give an excellent education to every child in India.

This weekend I participated in #leetcode biweekly and weekly contests and gave my best performances till now.

Today I managed to solve all 4 problems in leetcode weekly contest and got a global rank 1823 out of 19k participants.
I could have gotten a better rank today if I went ahead with the brute force solution for the first problem as the constraints were very less, but I kept on trying for an optimal approach and wasted half an hour on that problem :)

Imagine yourself on your deathbed.

Your partner whom you will never see again. The kids you could not get to spend time with. The regrets staring at you, fiercely.

In that moment, all you would beg for, is more time. 

Just one day, instead of postponing everything to tomorrowland, where 99% of all human productivity, motivation and achievement is stored.

I want you to vividly feel that helplessness.
As if it were happening right now to you.

Now come back to this moment, and think how it felt.
Most likely did not feel good.

Instead of giving you more guilt trips, I want to give you what you were most begging for: Time.

That time is what you have today.
You have time.
Doesn't matter how much.

You have today.

YOU HAVE TODAY!

#success #habits #time #warikoo

Don’t know why Dad is always lagging behind.

1. Mom carries for 9 months, Dad carries for 25 years, both are equal, still don’t know why Dad is lagging behind.

2. Mother works without pay for the family, Dad spends all his pay for the family, both their efforts are equal, still don’t know why Dad is lagging behind.

3. Mom cooks whatever you want, Dad buys whatever you want, both their love is equal, but Mom’s love is shown as superior. Don’t know why Dad is lagging behind.

4. When you talk over the phone, you want to talk to Mom first, if you get hurt, you cry ‘Mom’. You will only remember dad when you need him, but Dad never feels bad that you don’t remember him the other times? When it comes to receiving love from children, for generations, don’t know why Dad is lagging behind.

5. Cupboards will be filled with colorful sarees and many clothes for kids but Dad’s clothes are very few, he doesn’t care about his own needs, still don’t know why Dad is lagging behind.

6. Mom has many gold ornaments, but Dad has only one ring that was given during his wedding. Still Mom may complain of less jewellery and Dad doesn't. Still don't know why is Dad lagging behind.

7. Dad works very hard all his life to take care of the family, but when it comes to getting recognition, don't know why he is always lagging behind.

8. Mom says, we need to pay college tuition this month, please don’t buy a saree for me for the festival whereas dad has not even thought of new clothes.Both their love is equal, still don’t know why Dad is lagging behind.

9. When parents become old, children say, Mom is at least useful in taking care of household chores, but they say, Dad is useless.

Dad is behind (or ‘at the back’ ) because he is the backbone of the family. Because of him, we are able to stand erect. Probably, this is the reason why he is lagging behind....!!!

Dedicated to all the DAD's 💕🙏🏻 and my dad Sushanta Dasgupta

It is with the utmost JOY and the deepest gratitude that I announce I will begin my new career on Monday as an Keys Account Executive III with RealPage, Inc. focusing on the growth of their Digital Marketing products! 🎉 

If you know me, you know that nothing gets my blood flowing more than strategizing business solutions and serving the needs of multifamily clients. When you add to that my love for working with RealPage’s platforms over the course of my entire career in Property Management since 2004, I can genuinely say this new venture is an absolute dream come true! 🥳

Thank you to my longtime friend, former manager, and industry mentor Cinnamon McCauley for believing in me and cheering me along like a boss 💪🏼 throughout the interview process; to Aisha K. for opening this door to me initially and guiding me through the first and final steps of recruitment; and thank you to my new team and boss David Burns for trusting me in such a pivotal role working alongside such valued clients. I’m thankful, too, for the invaluable knowledge and training in digital marketing strategies I received in my role as a Mid-Market AE with McClatchy that helped align me for this opportunity. 

Most of all, thank you to my property management family over the years who have “raised me” in an industry that has become ingrained in my identity. My work family has always been a real family, and those who trained me how to put together paper lease files 18 years ago are as much to thank for this dream coming to fruition as anyone. 

I’m joining team RealPage, multifamily fam! 🤩 And this girl’s soul is set on 🔥 over it!

Let’s. Do. This. 👊🏼

The right moment can change everything…12 months ago today this pitch aired on Dragons Den 🐉
 
I remember sitting with the team (4 of us at the time) huddled around a desk in the office with some pizza as we watched the show. I don’t think any of us could have imagined quite how the journey would unfold in the days, weeks and months after:
 
🏡  We've moved into Touker Suleyman's offices

👥  We've grown the team from 4 - 18 (sorry Touker, it's a few more desks than we originally asked for!)

📈  Our users have spent more than 2000years of time browsing on Gener8!

💥 This pitch went viral with more than 30M views online and was called “the best pitch ever” in the papers

🗞  Gener8 Ads has been covered by more than 50 different press outlets

🐉  In a Dragon's Den first, we brought onboard another dragon after the show. With Tej Lalvani joining the movement.

⚽️  Harry Redknapp and 🎤 Tinie Tempah became investors.

📱 We’ve built and launched the beta version of our mobile app (it’s invite only at the moment, full launch coming soon!).

…And the best is yet to come! (keep your eyes peeled for some exciting announcements soon 👀 )
 
We’re looking for great people to join our journey, so if you’d like to be a part of something special please do check out the roles on our website.

12 months ago we had limped through covid and were running out of money. Make the most of your opportunities. You never know what's just around the corner 🙂

React/Angular/Vue are useless for public applications.

Any person thinking of creating a website or web app needs it to be crawled (except protected urls).

This very basic thing is not supported OOB in any of the frameworks and when we try to use them with something like nextjs or angular universal the design changes significantly.

So why are we using them?
Even for internal applications, would it not be easy to have one less framework to bother about?

We can use flask/django/php/RoR/JSP kinda stuff and increase velocity. I think we can maintain performance of the code and page loads as well and prerendering+caching or just caching would be much easier to do.

Thoughts?


PS: Yes I know I am stupid.

#ktalks

The story of Dinesh Karthik is amazing ❤️

He was doing very well and was the 2nd wkt keeper to MS in the Indian team and was captain of TN. His teammate Murali Vijay was having an affair with his wife and the entire TN Ranji team knew this but not DK.

They had a divorce and she moved in with Murali who was opening for CSK and India and doing really well. 

DK was shattered, went into deep depression, grew a beard & his performance dipped, and he was dropped from the India squad. He started failing in Ranji and lost his captaincy to Murali Vijay. He started failing in IPL too and was so depressed felt let down by his Ranji teammates and wanted to commit suicide. He stopped going to the gym.

His trainer visited him in his house and found DK in a complete mess. He insisted Dk start his training again and got him back to the gym where he was training Deepika Pallikal also.

Shocked to see him in a sorry state she started counselling him along with the trainer and slowly he started training. Both started working out like maniacs.

Murali Vijay married his wife but started failing....was first dropped from the Indian team and later from CSK also. Meanwhile encouraged by Deepika, DK started nets and scored heavily in the domestic matches. He was back in the reckoning, was again selected for white-ball cricket for India and became the captain of KKR.

He married Deepika.
However, after a few years, Rishab came and took his place.

At 34 he knew his time was up and he was dropped from KKR as captain. He wanted to retire and just play IPL. His wife got pregnant and they had twins. She also stopped playing. 

His dream was to own a luxurious house which he got as an offer at Poes garden. It cost a lot and he was not too sure if he could afford it. Deepika said grab it, we will both come back. She started training along with DK. They bought the palatial house.

DK got a call from Kasi of CSK saying thala wanted him as wk when he retired from CSK and DK was in reckoning. At the auction in 2022, CSK tried their best to get him but were outbid by RCB. CSK settled for Devon Conway. 

Deepika played the world championship at Glasgow in squash 6 months after delivery & won both the mixed doubles & women's double with Joshna Ponnappa. An energised father, now DK started kicking ass, won crucial matches for RCB. He is now back with a bang and wants to make it into the T20 WC team as a finisher in place of retired MS. 

Hope he really makes it.
Amazing couple DK and Deepika.....
truly made for each other ❤️

I’m happy to share that I have been promoted to Director at EY.

I joined the #workforce in the late 90s.

Everyone in my generation, on average, had three siblings and joined the workforce(mostly).

Everyone I am employing right now, on average, has two siblings.

Everyone in my generation, on average, has just one child who will be joining the workforce soon.

------------------------------

What does it mean for you if you are an employer?

Hiring a young workforce will become increasingly difficult as the years go by.

You will need to make the best use of your current employee base.

Your workforce will become increasingly older.

If you are lucky enough to have a young workforce, treat them like GOLD.

Invest in their long-term #productivity. 

Invest in their long-term #healthandwellbeing.

------------------------------

The world is a noisy place. 

We get a very small window of opportunity to get people to know us. 

So we have to be very clear on what we want them to know about us.

If you just talk about your product, how good it is, how fast it is, how cheap it is, it’s less likely to make an impact.

I think I rarely look at a Nike ad and go, "ooh nice, Nike has better soles than other brands."

I'd more likely be inspired by the stories Nike shares in their ads.

No one cares how you’re better than your competitors.

It’s more about who you are.

What you stand for.

Where do you fit in this world?

What stories are you trying to tell?

As an individual, I always try to think how I fit in this world. 

It’s more of an existential question, really. 

But I guess, it also has an impact on my professional life.

What I can bring to the table.

Why should people give me time, money, or energy?

What I believe in.

The people in the noisy world will pause only to hear stories that move them.

I think we need to figure out our stories.

Not talk about what we sell.

But what we live for.

#storytelling #product #marketing
